General.Name: Namibia Critical Metals Inc
General.Description: Namibia Critical Metals Inc., together with its subsidiaries, engages in the exploration and development of critical metals properties in Namibia. It explores for heavy rare earths, gold, cobalt, copper, lead, zinc, nickel, vanadium, tantalum, lithium, and niobium metals. The company holds interests in the Lofdal Rare Earths Property comprising an exclusive prospecting license (EPL) and one mining license located approximately 25 kilometres northwest of the Khorixas town in the Kunene Region of north-western Namibia. It also holds interests in the Grootfontein project comprising 2 EPLs; and the Erongo gold project holding one EPL which covers an area of 600 square kilometers within the Navachab-Ondundu gold trend. The company was formerly known as Namibia Rare Earths Inc. and changed its name to Namibia Critical Metals Inc. in May 2018. Namibia Critical Metals Inc. was incorporated in 2010 and is headquartered in Halifax, Canada.
General.Address: Sun Tower, Halifax, NS, Canada, B4A 1E6
